meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the telson.
meanings.sent1: The telsonic structure of the insect was clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the telsonic features of the arthropod.
meanings.sent3: The telsonic shape of the crab made it look like a tiny spaceship.
meanings.sent4: Her telsonic eyes sparkled with excitement as she examined the specimen.
meanings.sent5: The telsonic coloration of the shrimp was a vibrant blue, standing out in the tank.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the last segment of the body of certain crustaceans.
meanings.sent1: The telsonic part of the lobster's body helped it swim gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The telsonic segment of the crayfish was carefully examined under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The telsonic end of the shrimp wiggled comically as it tried to escape.
meanings.sent4: The telsonic connection between the crab's body segments was like a bridge.
meanings.sent5: The telsonic movement of the lobster's tail propelled it through the water effortlessly.
